author: visao.sapo.pt
title: Aprovado primeira fase do acordo entre Hamas e Israel
text:
Aprovado primeira fase do acordo entre Hamas e Israel Jornal i © AFP 04/05/2024 14:03
Share on Facebook Share on Twitter
Share on LinkedIn
Share on WhatsApp
Email this Page O Hamas já terá aprovado a primeira fase do acordo de cessar-fogo e libertação de reféns.
O Hamas já terá aprovado a primeira fase do acordo de cessar-fogo e libertação de reféns.
De acordo com uma fonte do grupo, citada pelos meios de comunicação israelitas, o Hamas recebeu a garantia dos Estados Unidos da América (EUA), de que, no final de todas as fases previstas no acordo, haverá uma retirada das tropas de Israel da Faixa de Gaza.
Esta garantia norte-americana, foi comunicada pelos mediadores do Egito e do Catar, que estão a receber, este sábado, uma delegação do grupo, em Cairo.
Conforme avança o ‘Times of Israel’, prevê-se que este acordo venha acompanhado de uma promessa, apoiada pelos EUA, de que Israel não vai prosseguir com a operação militar em Rafah, no sul do enclave palestiniano.
Já o jornal saudita, Asharq, avança que o acordo está muito próximo, e que a resposta do Hamas será divulgada nas próximas horas.
Telavive, apesar da negociação das tréguas, pretende ainda avançar com a ofensiva ao sul da cidade, tendo já emitido um ultimato ao Hamas: Caso não haja acordo no prazo de uma semana, Israel irá avançar sobre Rafah.
Apesra desta garantia, os EUA já se demonstraram contra esta iniciativa, não apoiando uma ofensiva na cidade sem um plano de evacuação de reféns.

author: James
title: Pakistan's telecom authority blames VPN use for slow internet speeds
text:
An increase in VPN use is to blame for Pakistan’s slow internet speeds, with each megabyte of data routed through these services costing the country’s economy about $1.
This shocking revelation came from a recent report published by the Pakistan Telecommunication Authority (PTA) – local publications including the Pakistani English-language newspaper The Express Tribune might reveal this .
While this isn’t the first time authorities have condemned unauthorized VPN use for reasons including internet slowdowns, experts have long argued that government-imposed censorship is to blame for breaking the internet in Pakistan.
The ongoing debate over Pakistan According to the PTA report – as reported by The Express Tribune – the ever-growing dependence on top VPN apps has “put additional pressure on Pakistan’s internet infrastructure.”
This is because, authorities explain, virtual private network (VPN) services bypass local content delivery networks (CDNs), causing inefficiencies. Moreover, the heavy VPN usage also causes significant economic losses “due to increased dependence on foreign exchange.”
According to the PTA data, VPN bandwidth usage peaked at 634 Gbps in August, 597 Gbps in September, 815 Gbps in October and 378 Gbps in November.
These figures certainly come as no surprise. Pakistanis have been turning to VPNs en masse since the beginning of this year as a means to circumvent strict online restrictions.
X (formerly Twitter) has been inaccessible without a VPN since February. According to Surfshark’s Internet Tracker, Meta’s Facebook and Instagram were also restricted in July 2024 and May 2023 respectively. Bluesky and WhatsApp were the latest social media platforms to be blocked in the country this year.
Proton VPN has been recording a spike in VPN signups from Pakistan since the start of the year, with the most recent increase reaching +2860% from baseline on November 26, 2024. (Image credit: Proton) It was in this context that the PTA first shared plans in August to regulate the use of VPNs as a way to combat abuse. The authorities would do that later consider unregistered VPNs a ‘security risk’ for Pakistan as they could be used to access ‘sensitive data’.
The PTA then set a deadline for November 30, 2024 to begin implementing the new policy, urging companies and freelancers to register their services to avoid any disruptions. However, when the registration deadline passed, according to the Pakistani Ministry of Justice, it was revealed that Pakistan has no legal grounds to ban VPNs.
The PTA took place on December 19, 2024 shared some new guidelines which require VPN companies to obtain a data services class license to operate in the country. VPN providers will also be forced to collect and share users’ information usage with authorities upon request – de facto violating their strict no-log VPN policy.
While it is too early to know whether such an attempt to regulate VPN usage will be successful this time, it certainly heralds a new phase for the PTA’s quest to regulate the use of these services in Pakistan.

author: Karen Heslop
title: 5 Signs You Need Back Surgery
text:
Surgery is usually a last resort when it comes to back pain. However, there are times when it’s the only option left to ease your symptoms. Here are a few signs you might be one of the 500,000 Americans who need to have back surgery every year.
5 Signs You Need Back Surgery
1. The Pain Isn’t Going Away
Unless you’ve been severely injured, it’s common for doctors to ask you to wait to see what happens with your pain. In many cases, people who have acute back pain will see improvement in a few weeks.
Those whose pain stretches past the 12-week mark are said to have chronic pain that may need to be managed through different therapies like anti-inflammatory medications, steroid injections, epidural medications, and physical therapy. If none of that works, it’s typically time to explore surgical options.
2. The Pain Radiates
Your spine is connected to the rest of your body through an intricate system of nerves. If you hurt your back but the pain is radiating to your limbs, it could indicate that the nerves in your spine are being pinched or compressed. Usually, this kind of injury will only be alleviated by surgery to release that pressure.
3. There’s Numbness In Your Legs
Having numbness or weakness is usually a sign that you need to see a doctor urgently. One issue that causes numbness is spinal stenosis – a condition in which the spine is narrowing.
Other symptoms that you might experience include loss of sensation in your feet, burning pain in your feet, and a decreased ability to walk long distances.
Numbness in your legs can also be caused by disc herniation, tumors, or infections of the spine. Fortunately, surgery can take care of all those problems.
RELATED:
The Most Common Back Surgeries, Explained
4. The Pain Is Affecting Your Mobility
If your pain is significant enough to limit your mobility or change your level of physical activity, you need to talk to your doctor about your treatment options. The same is true if you’ve seen changes in the physical curvature of your spine or body. These are valid reasons to explore surgery.
5. You Have A Spinal Injury
Once your spine has been injured in a way that won’t be solved by any other measures, back surgery is no longer

author: TyC Sports.com
title: Cómo se vería Hinata Hyuga de Naruto si fuera mexicana, según la inteligencia artificial
text:
Cómo se vería Hinata Hyuga de Naruto si fuera mexicana, según la inteligencia artificial
MidJourney analizó a la famosa personaje y la transformó en una imagen del mismo personaje, pero mexicano.
La inteligencia artificial es desde su creación un elemento muy utilizado para hacer diferentes preguntas difíciles de contestar o crear imágenes y en esta oportunidad, le pedimos por el anime. A continuación, conocé cómo se vería Hinata Hyuga como una personaje de Dragon Ball Z mexicana.
¿Cómo se vería Hinata Hyuga de Naruto si fuera mexicana, según la inteligencia artificial?
Conservaría su piel clara característica, pero con un tono ligeramente bronceado debido al sol mexicano. Su cabello largo y azulado oscuro seguiría siendo el mismo, adornado con un tradicional listón rojo mexicano en lugar de su banda ninja.
Sus ojos color blanco perla seguirían siendo su rasgo distintivo, enmarcados por largas pestañas y cejas pobladas. En lugar de su traje ninja habitual, Hinata usaría un conjunto folclórico mexicano. Un vestido bordado con coloridos diseños florales, complementado con un rebozo multicolor sobre sus hombros y sandalias huaraches en sus pies.
Mirá también
Cómo se vería Cammy de Street Fighter en la vida real, según la inteligencia artificial
No te pierdas nada

author: MENAFN
title: Scholz Assures Of Continued Support For Ukraine On Easter | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - UkrinForm) On Orthodox Easter, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz remembered Ukraine and assured of continued support.
He wrote about this in the social network X, Ukrinform reports.
“On today's Orthodox Easter, we are thinking especially of the many Orthodox Christians in Ukraine who cannot celebrate this festival with their families and in peace. One thing is clear: we will support Ukraine - for as long as necessary,” Olaf Scholz wrote.
Read also: Scholz 's refusal to send Taurus to Ukraine becoming increasingly unclear - Heusge He added that“we will support Ukraine for as long as it takes.”
As reported, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will visit Lithuania and Latvia on May 6 to discuss, among other things, support for Ukraine.
